top_comment.text:
How to turn this video from great, to Fucking Awesome:

1) Pause this video at 00:24

2) Open a new tab on Youtube and enter: /watch?v=0hyGM3uyzQc

3) Play both at the same time. It should sync perfectly.

4) Enjoy!﻿

top_comment.author: SRAMEK

comments.text:
+tyler t Actually, after some time I admit that this comment was a bit too 
rough, BUT! I meant it a little bit different than you probably think. I 
don't say, that there are worse drivers in NASCAR for example, I mean that 
some spectators blame road-course racing to be boring etc etc, so I said to 
show it to them, not to the drivers.

And yes, I do realize this fact, but there are also some very extraordinary 
drivers. For example for me, watching cars racing at night during a rain is 
so great, NASCAR lacks this, but NASCAR is about somthing else, but I do 
not say, that you cannot find great drivers there.
comments.author: SRAMEK

comments.text:
+SRAMEK Really? Almendinger and Speed are both national karting champions 
with plenty of formula car and road racing experience.

They'd have no trouble competing in this race. You do realize that like 90% 
of the field in VLN is just rich people who paid to be there right?
comments.author: tyler t

comments.text:
Its simple 69' camaro = Drag car Nissan GTR = track car. using that point 
as a base then all different sports are well just that different you cannot 
use a football as a soccer ball
comments.author: Jin Kazama

comments.text:
What's the obsession with driving a dagger between NASCAR and other forms 
of motorsport? What does this video have to do with NASCAR? This is like 
saying that we should show these apples to any oranges, and then "watch 
them try to say something". Your point is ill conceived and uninteresting. 
If you think that NASCAR drivers do not have world class skill in car and 
throttle control, you're mistaken. The amount of counter steering 
required--and yes, this means (gasp!) turning the wheel to the right--to 
keep a stock car on its line can be insane, especially as grip and wear 
levels change. Many of the top stock car racers learned their craft on 
dirt; they are no strangers to slippery, bumpy, and difficult racing 
surfaces.
comments.author: semple3

comments.author: SRAMEK

comments.text:
Carl Edwards defeated Michael Schumacher in the Race of Champions.
In the past when Nascar ran on road courses, team owners would hire so 
called "Ringers" to drive the cars. Ringers were drivers like Gurney, 
Donahue or Villeneuve.
Nowadays the ringers are almost a thing from the past. Very rarely you will 
see a ringer in a Nascar. Even more rarely you will see them win races.
Ringers like Ambrose, Montoya and Almendinger, while they are very 
competitive at road courses, they still haven't won a oval race at Nascar, 
simply because it is a total different kind of racing.
comments.author: bowelrupture

comments.text:
+bowelrupture
And when the right hander comes?
comments.author: The Inappropriate Gentleman

comments.text:
Totally different types of motor racing. And believe me, give a Nascar 
driver a VLN car and some time to learn the track, he will be fast too.
comments.author: bowelrupture
